★ Max building. height is:
• 30′ for structures w/roof slope < 12:12
• 33′ for structures w/roof slope > 12:12
• 17′ for structures on substandard or flag lots
regardless of flood plane

except on substandard and flag lots - up to 33′

not exceed 15′ on any one side.
Rear protrusions subject to same rules

visual_elements.description: A side elevation diagram of a residential building illustrating the primary daylight plane from the rear. It shows the building's height, roofline, and dormers. Various dimensions and setback lines are indicated with arrows and labels. The diagram includes a ground line with hatching, a 'Rear yard' area, a 'Setback line', and a 'Rear lot line'. A dashed line representing the daylight plane extends from the setback line at a 60-degree angle upwards and over the building. Protrusion limits are shown above the building.

technical_specifications.parameter: Building height from ground to roofline (approximate, indicated by 16' dimension)
Max building height for structures with roof slope < 12:12
Max building height for structures with roof slope > 12:12
Max building height for structures on substandard or flag lots (regardless of flood plane)
Max building height for structures in flood zones (except substandard and flag lots)
Cumulative length of protrusions (max) on any one side

sections: Fig 23 Side elevation showing Rear primary daylight plane
Note: There is no front daylight plane.
Cumulative length of protrusions must not exceed 15′ on any one side.
Rear protrusions subject to same rules as side protrusions

additional_notes: The page number '28' is located at the bottom left corner.

The diagram includes asterisks (*) next to 'Max building. height is:' and 'Cumulative length of protrusions must not exceed 15′ on any one side.' which likely refer to specific regulations or definitions elsewhere in the manual, though no direct legend is provided on this page.
The text '24' max. for protrusions' appears twice, once as a label on the left side of the diagram and once as a label on the right side, indicating the same measurement.
cross_references: Rules for side protrusions (implied by 'Rear protrusions subject to same rules as side protrusions')
